name: St. Lydia
summary: Lydia of Thyatira was a successful businesswoman who dealt in purple cloth, a luxury item in the ancient world. She is recorded in the Acts of the Apostles as the first European convert to Christianity, baptized by Paul during his first visit to Philippi. After her conversion, she opened her home to Paul and his companions, and her house became the meeting place for the church in Philippi. She is venerated as a saint and is considered the patron saint of dyers.
